alert.note: Alert for St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 27 at 9:21AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands. * WHEN...From 2 PM AST this afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Plenty of tropical moisture and favorable upper-level conditions will bring periods of showers and thunderstorms across the local islands through at least Tuesday. However, wet conditions are possible Wednesday through Friday next week. Based on the most recent guidance, scattered to numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms will reach the US Virgin Islands later this afternoon and tonight, and across the rest of the forecast area by Saturday. Periods of showers will continue to prevail on Sunday as well. The areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations are the interior, eastern and southern sections of Puerto Rico as well as the US Virgin Islands. In these areas, there is the potential for rainfall totals of 3-8 inches through at least Tuesday. Elsewhere across Puerto Rico, rainfall totals of 3-5 inches are possible. There is an elevated risk for flooding of urban areas,roads and small streams. Life threatening flash flooding and mudslides are possible as well. Some rivers will likely overflow their banks. As a result the Flash Flood Watch is in effect through at least Monday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
